awd_titl_txt: Data Structures for Robotic Learning Algorithms
awd_abstract_narration: This award is to support a postdoctoral associate to work in               experimental computer science.  The associate, Marcos                           Salganicoff, will work with Dr. Ruzena Bajcsy on problems                       involving robot control and planning.                                                                                                                                The research will blend learning, data structures, and                     parallelism.  Planning information will be stored in binary trees               (such a k-D-trees or quadtrees).  This information, usually                     massive amounts of it, is then used in learning algorithms.  A                  hybrid approach using distributed workstations for some of the                  computation and a MIMD computer for some of the rest will be                    employed to implement these learning algorithms in a cost                       effective manner.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
